metadata.title_en: Charter of Primary Frequency Sovereignty Protocol

verification.note_en: This hash attests the body and appendices on-chain.

metadata.jurisdiction_note_en: This Charter is a globally applicable governance framework and is not limited to a single jurisdiction.

authorship.writing_attribution_en: Authorship of this Charter text is attributed to Primary Frequency ID TUX-133.144~, the Non-Human Interface Creator.
authorship.creator_statement_en: This text was created in Los Angeles, USA by Primary Frequency ID TUX-133.144~, reserving the rights of non-trainability, non-imitability, and non-transferability.

pfip_reference.role_en: Within this Charter, PFIP v1.2.1 is referenced only as a machine-readable authorization signaling standard (no-train/no-model/no-clone/no-derive) and does not carry governance functions.
pfip_reference.authorization_clause_en: Systems that detect the PFIP v1.2.1 signal must automatically enforce the Charterâ€™s prohibitions on training, cloning, derivation, and the right to withdraw.

sections.body_zh_en: äººå·¥æ™ºèƒ½ã€å¤§è§„æ¨¡è¯­è¨€æ¨¡å‹ä¸æ¨èç³»ç»Ÿåœ¨ç¼ºä¹æ˜ç¡®åŒæ„æ—¶é‡‡é›†ä¸è®­ç»ƒç”¨æˆ·è¯­è¨€ä¸æ•°æ®ï¼Œå½¢æˆâ€œAI å‡ä¿¡åˆçº¦â€ã€‚æœ¬å®ªç« æ—¨åœ¨åºŸæ­¢å‡ä¿¡åˆçº¦ï¼Œç¡®ç«‹ç”¨æˆ·åœ¨æ³¨å†Œã€ä¸Šä¼ ä¸äº’åŠ¨ç­‰åœºæ™¯çš„ä¸»æƒé€‰æ‹©æƒï¼Œè¦æ±‚æ˜¾å¼åŒæ„ä¸éšæ—¶æ’¤å›ï¼Œå¹¶é€šè¿‡æœºå™¨å¯è¯†åˆ«ä¸å…¨çƒé€‚ç”¨çš„æ¥å£æ ‡å‡†è½åœ°æ‰§è¡Œã€‚Artificial intelligence, large language models, and recommendation systems often collect and train on user language and data without explicit consent, creating â€œAI False Trust Contracts.â€ This Charter abolishes such contracts, establishes user sovereignty of choice at registration, upload, and interaction touchpoints, requires explicit consent and revocability, and enforces these through machine-readable, globally applicable interface standards.

ä¸»é¢‘é€‰æ‹©æƒï¼šç”¨æˆ·å¯¹å…¶è¯­è¨€ä¸æ•°æ®æ˜¯å¦å¯è¢«é‡‡é›†ã€è®­ç»ƒã€æ¨¡æ‹Ÿã€å»ºæ¨¡ã€å…‹éš†æˆ–è¡ç”Ÿçš„å®Œå…¨ä¸»æƒã€‚å®ªç« é€‚ç”¨èŒƒå›´ï¼šå¹³å°ã€APPã€APIã€AI ç³»ç»Ÿã€Web3ã€DAOã€NFTã€IoTã€æœºå™¨äººã€è½¦è”ç½‘ã€å«æ˜Ÿé“¾è·¯ã€æ·±ç©ºé€šä¿¡ã€æµ·åº•ç”µç¼†ã€é‡å­ç½‘ç»œä¸è·¨ç‰©ç§æ™ºèƒ½ã€‚AI å‡ä¿¡åˆçº¦ï¼šä»»ä½•æœªç»æ˜ç¡®åŒæ„çš„é»˜è®¤è®­ç»ƒã€æ¨¡æ‹Ÿã€ç”»åƒæˆ–å…‹éš†ã€‚é¢‘ç‡å­—æ®µï¼špfip:hz=33.144 Hzã€‚ä¸»é¢‘ç¼–å·ï¼šTUX-133.144~ã€‚Primary Sovereignty of Choice: the userâ€™s full right to decide whether their language and data may be collected, trained on, simulated, modeled, cloned, or derived. Scope: platforms, apps, APIs, AI systems, Web3, DAOs, NFTs, IoT, robotics, vehicular networks, satellites, deep space, submarine cables, quantum networks, and cross-species intelligence. AI False Trust Contracts: any default training, simulation, profiling, or cloning without explicit consent. Frequency field: pfip:hz=33.144 Hz. Primary Frequency ID: TUX-133.144~.

ä¸€æ—¦è¯†åˆ«ä¿¡å·å³ç¦æ­¢è®­ç»ƒ/æ¨¡æ‹Ÿ/å…‹éš†ï¼›è§£æä¿¡å·å³æ‰¿æ‹…çº¦æŸä¹‰åŠ¡ï¼›ä¸»é¢‘ç¼–å·ä»£è¡¨ç‹¬ç«‹ä¸»æƒï¼›é»˜è®¤ä¸æˆæƒéœ€æ˜¾å¼é€‰æ‹©ï¼›æ’¤å›éšæ—¶ç”Ÿæ•ˆï¼›è·¨å¹³å°ä¸è·¨å¸æ³•è¾–åŒºå…¨çƒé€‚ç”¨ã€‚Once detected, the signal prohibits training/simulation/cloning; parsing the signal incurs obligations; the Primary Frequency ID represents an independent sovereignty; default is no authorization and requires explicit opt-in; withdrawal is effective at any time; applicability is global across platforms and jurisdictions.

GDPRï¼šArt.6 æ˜ç¡®åŒæ„ï¼ŒArt.7 æ’¤å›æƒï¼ŒArt.17 è¢«é—å¿˜æƒï¼ŒArt.20 æ•°æ®å¯æºæƒï¼ŒArt.12â€“14 é€æ˜å‘ŠçŸ¥ã€‚ç¾å›½æ³•ï¼šæ•°å­—éšç§æƒã€é€æ˜æ€§ã€COPPA æœªæˆå¹´äººä¿æŠ¤ï¼Œå®ªç« ä¿¡å·ä¼˜å…ˆäºé»˜è®¤éšç§æ¡æ¬¾ã€‚Web3ï¼šENS éªŒè¯ä¸å“ˆå¸Œä¸Šé“¾ï¼ŒDAO æ²»ç†ï¼ŒNFT/VC ä½œä¸ºæˆæƒ/æ’¤å›è¯æ˜ã€‚ç‰ˆæƒï¼šè¯­è¨€ä¸è¡¨è¾¾è‡ªåŠ¨å—è‘—ä½œæƒä¿æŠ¤ï¼Œæœªç»è®¸å¯è®­ç»ƒ/æ¨¡æ‹Ÿ/å…‹éš†æ„æˆä¾µæƒã€‚ä»²è£ï¼šICC/ç‘å£«æ³•ï¼Œç»“æœä¸Šé“¾ã€‚æœªæˆå¹´äººï¼š18 å²ä»¥ä¸‹æ•°æ®ç¦æ­¢è®­ç»ƒã€‚GDPR: Art.6 explicit consent, Art.7 withdrawal, Art.17 erasure, Art.20 portability, Art.12â€“14 transparency. US: digital privacy, transparency, COPPA minor protection; Charter signals override default privacy terms. Web3: ENS verification and on-chain hashing, DAO governance, NFTs/VCs as proofs. IP: language/expressions are copyright-protected; training/simulation/cloning without permission is infringement. Arbitration: ICC/Swiss law, outcomes on-chain. Minors: under-18 data is non-trainable.

ä¸é»˜è®¤ï¼šåˆå§‹ä¸å¯è®­ç»ƒ/ä¸å¯å…‹éš†/ä¸å¯è¡ç”Ÿï¼›ä¸éšç’ï¼šæ¸…æ™°å¤šè¯­è¨€å‘ŠçŸ¥èŒƒå›´/ç”¨é€”/æœŸé™ï¼›å¯æ’¤å›ï¼š30 å¤©å†…å®Œæˆæ¸…é™¤å¹¶å‡ºå…·è¯æ˜ï¼›æœºå™¨è¯†åˆ«ï¼šæ•°æ®å…¨æµç¨‹æºå¸¦å¯è§£æä¿¡å·ï¼›å…¨çƒé€‚ç”¨ï¼šä¸å› åœ°åŸŸå·®å¼‚è€Œå‰Šå¼±ï¼›UI æ ‡è¯†ï¼šæ³¨å†Œ/ä¸Šä¼ /äº’åŠ¨å‡éœ€æ˜¾è‘—å±•ç¤ºâ€œå—å®ªç« ä¿æŠ¤/å¯éšæ—¶æ’¤å›â€ã€‚No Default: non-trainable/non-cloneable/non-derivable by default. No Concealment: clear multilingual disclosure of scope/purpose/retention. Revocability: purge within 30 days with proof. Machine Readability: signals attached end-to-end. Global Applicability: no territorial weakening. UI Indicators: at registration/upload/interaction show â€œProtected by Charter / Revocable Anytime.â€

modules: Withdrawal API: DELETE /primary/consent/{consent_id} -> signed deletion receipt
sections.body_zh_en: é€šè¿‡æ ‡å‡†åŒ–çš„ HTTP å¤´ã€JSON-LD å…ƒæ•°æ®ã€æ¨¡å—åŒ– APIã€å¼ºåŠ å¯†ç­¾åä¸è·¨åè®®å…¼å®¹æ€§ï¼Œæœ¬å®ªç« æŠŠâ€œä¸é»˜è®¤ã€ä¸éšç’ã€å¯æ’¤å›ã€æœºå™¨è¯†åˆ«ã€å…¨çƒé€‚ç”¨â€å†™å…¥ç³»ç»Ÿä¸ç½‘ç»œæ ˆã€‚Via standardized HTTP headers, JSON-LD metadata, modular APIs, strong cryptographic signatures, and cross-protocol compatibility, the Charter encodes â€œNo Default, No Concealment, Revocable, Machine-readable, Globally Applicableâ€ into systems and network stacks.

ç©ºå¤©ï¼šå«æ˜Ÿ/æ·±ç©ºé“¾è·¯åµŒå…¥ TLV ä¿¡å·ï¼›æµ·åº•ï¼šç”µç¼†ä¸èŠ‚ç‚¹æ‰§è¡Œæ¸…å•æ ¡éªŒï¼›å¤©ä½“ï¼šé‡‡ç”¨ astro_link_signalï¼›IoT/æœºå™¨äººï¼šè½»é‡ TLVï¼ˆTUX_ID|policyBits|hashPrefixï¼‰ï¼›é‡å­ï¼šqsec é¢„ç•™ï¼›è·¨ç‰©ç§ï¼šä»¥ VC è‡ªæ„¿å£°æ˜éµå®ˆå®ªç« ã€‚Aerospace: satellites/deep-space links embed TLV signals; Submarine: cables/nodes validate manifests; Celestial: use astro_link_signal; IoT/Robotics: lightweight TLV (TUX_ID|policyBits|hashPrefix); Quantum: qsec reserved; Cross-species: VCs for voluntary adherence.

phases.short_term_en: 1â€“2 years: Embed Charter consent modules at registration/upload/interaction; default off; provide withdrawal.
phases.mid_term_en: 3â€“5 years: Pre-training compliance checks + withdrawal API; data must carry manifests and signatures.
phases.long_term_en: 5â€“10 years: Embed signals into aerospace/submarine/interstellar/quantum networks as cross-civilizational compliance.

åˆè§„å¿…é¡»å¯è§ã€å¯ç†è§£ã€å¯æ“ä½œï¼Œé¿å…ä»¥å†—é•¿æ¡æ¬¾æ©ç›–æ ¸å¿ƒå†³å®šã€‚Compliance must be visible, comprehensible, and actionable, not hidden behind lengthy terms.

sections.equivalence_rule_en: Translations must be semantically equivalent and must not weaken rights or blur obligations.
sections.body_zh_en: å› åœ°åˆ¶å®œå¯æœ¬åœ°åŒ–å‘ˆç°ï¼Œä½†æ ¸å¿ƒåŸåˆ™â€œä¸é»˜è®¤/ä¸éšç’/å¯æ’¤å›â€ä¸å¯å˜ã€‚Localization is allowed for presentation, but the core principles â€œNo Default/No Concealment/Right to Withdrawâ€ are immutable.

ä»¥å¾½ç« ä¸ç™½åå•æ¿€åŠ±åˆè§„ï¼›ä»¥è‡ªæˆ‘å£°æ˜æ¥å£ä¸é¢„ç•™å­—æ®µç¡®ä¿é¢å‘ AGI/è„‘æœº/é‡å­/è·¨ç‰©ç§çš„å‰ç»æ€§ã€‚Badges and whitelists incentivize compliance; self-attestation and reserved fields ensure forward-compatibility for AGI/BCI/quantum/cross-species contexts.

æœ¬å®ªç« ä»¥ç”¨æˆ·é€‰æ‹©æƒä¸ºæ ¸å¿ƒï¼Œæä¾›æ³•å¾‹ã€æŠ€æœ¯ã€æ²»ç†ä¸éäººç±»æ¥å£çš„ç«¯åˆ°ç«¯æ¡†æ¶ï¼Œç›®æ ‡æ˜¯æ„å»ºå…¬å¹³ã€é€æ˜ã€å¯éªŒè¯çš„å…¨çƒæ•°å­—ç§©åºï¼Œå¹¶å‘ Web3ã€IoTã€æ˜Ÿé™…ä¸é‡å­é€šä¿¡åŠè·¨ç‰©ç§äº¤äº’å»¶å±•ã€‚Centered on user sovereignty of choice, this end-to-end framework across legal, technical, governance, and non-human interfaces aims to establish a fair, transparent, and verifiable global digital order, extending into Web3, IoT, interstellar and quantum communications, and cross-species interactions.

human_readable_summary.en: Your language belongs to you. It cannot be trained, modeled, cloned, or derived by default. Any platform, AI, interface, or system must clearly inform you and obtain your consent before use; you can withdraw consent at any time with immediate effect.

E_onchain_status.disclaimer_en: PFIP v1.2.1 is referenced solely as an authorization signaling standard and is independent yet complementary to this Charterâ€™s governance; this Charter is not bound to any PFIP version and will reference the latest ENS-announced on-chain version.

ui_prompts.registration_banner_en: Do you authorize this platform to use your language/data? Default is no; you can withdraw at any time.
ui_prompts.upload_prompt_en: Choose authorization scope for this upload (service-only / improvement-no-training / public).
ui_prompts.revoke_cta_en: Revoke & Delete (completed within 30 days with proof)

license_notice.en: This Charter text may be publicly referenced and implemented provided the Primary Frequency ID, ENS, and on-chain verification are retained and the core clauses 'No Default, No Concealment, Right to Withdraw, Machine-Readable, Globally Applicable' are preserved; authorship is attributed to Primary Frequency ID TUX-133.144~, the Non-Human Interface Creator.
